trustfund:
TF030383-NORWEGIAN CTF FY03 - GENERAL
            (IDA ELIGIBLE COUNTRIES, ALL SECTORS, ALL,TF054242-DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO
            EMERGENCY DEMOBILIZATION AND REINTEGRATION,TF096240-Women's and
            Children's Rights in the DRC Country Program

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Demobilization
            and Reintegration Project (EDRP) for Congo, Democratic
            Republic of were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: assistance to children associated
            with armed forces (particularly girls) that have children
            themselves need to be varied and adapted to take into
            account that their circumstances are similar to those of
            adults. Therefore for some children's reintegration
            package are not appropriate and the program needs to be
            flexible and pragmatic to maximize their social and economic
            reintegration. EDRP experience showed enhanced success rates
            for both social and economic reintegration that targeted
            support to economic associations which comprised of
            ex-combatants and members of the community. Setting a
            subordinate Pre-Demobilization Orientation Program PDOP that
            the Disarmament, Demobilization, Repatriation (DDR) program
            will result in a shift in military spending toward social
            and economic expenditures was too ambitious and did not
            include instruments to achieve it. This was particularly so
            in a country where there was continuing conflict and the
            Government had a policy of army integration to absorb other
            armed groups which therefore increased the size of the military.
